Table.name: Acceptance
Table.Comment: Value table for accepted/rejected in requisitionSignature

Table.name: Agent
Table.Comment: value table Agent The list of values for different types of ingredients

Table.name: Assortment
Table.Comment: range of goods

Table.name: AuditDefinition
Table.Comment: Defines all tables were changes will be tracked

Table.name: AutIdem
Table.Comment: disallow substitution of a medicine with another one containing the same agent, or allow

Table.name: Imported
Table.Comment: Value for giving a sign when an assortment is imported from an external system

Table.name: ItemIdentification
Table.Comment: Identification data for an item (external numbers, barcode data)

Table.name: ItemIdentType
Table.Comment: type of item identification number (GTIN, PZN, HIBC,....)

Table.name: ItemIngredient
Table.Comment: Deliverer item information

Table.name: ItemStatusType
Table.Comment: list of status types for items: stock item, non-stock item, ...

Table.name: ItemText
Table.Comment: various texts belonging to an item

Table.name: ItemTextType
Table.Comment: text types for an item: general text, dosing hint, patient information leaflet, requisition text

Table.name: Narcotic
Table.Comment: list of values for narcotic: yes, no

Table.name: OrgUnitExtension
Table.Comment: A Wrapper Class/Table for Bas_OrgUnit

Table.name: PrescriptionRequirement
Table.Comment: List of Values for Prescription Requirement

Table.name: ProviderItem
Table.Comment: Provider item information

Table.name: RequisitionBasket
Table.Comment: Shopping Basket for Requisitions all item requisitions will be collected here after signing they will move to the requisition

Table.name: RequisitionMode
Table.Comment: Value for giving a sign when an assortment is imported from an external system

Table.name: RequisitionPosition
Table.Comment: Item List for signed Requisitions

Table.name: RequisitionSignature
Table.Comment: signature list for a requisition. in a workflow there are steps for accepting a requisition - this steps will be documented here

Table.name: RequisitionState
Table.Comment: list of states of a requisition: entered, rejected, signed, completed, ...

Table.name: RequisitionType
Table.Comment: different types of requisitions (standard, express,...)

Table.name: Subset
Table.Comment: subset of items

Table.name: SubsetItem
Table.Comment: range of goods

Table.name: Text
Table.Comment: single text snippet up to 1900 characters

Table.name: TextShelf
Table.Comment: shelf for all texts needed

Table.name: TextType
Table.Comment: text type: plain text, undefined
